head.supplied: QUARTERLY ESTIMATE. ¶ To the Honorable ¶ ¶ the Chief Secretary ¶ Sir, ¶ I have the honor to submit for approval the following Estimate* of Expenditure during the Quarter ending ¶ ¶ 31st Decr 1 ¶ 87 ...

div.p: O78/435, unit 985, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

note.p: MS written by G. Luehmann and signed by him for M, who was absent in WA at the time.

div.p: To the Honorable the Chief Secretary

I have the honor to submit for approval the following Estimate* of Expenditure during the Quarter ending 31st Decr 1877.
On 20 December a memo addressed to M had been sent by the Under-Treasurer, E. Symonds, saying that a remittancefor £75 'has been passed in anticipation of the usual Estimate K being received duly approved. If an application to the Hon. the Cf. Secretary hasnot already been made, it is desirable that no further delay may occur'. The document submitted by Luehmann, which is a completed Form K,was no doubt filed in response to this.
The file includes an undated MS annotation by 'H. B.'[HenryBrook]:'A remittance a/c for the outgoing mail has been passed to the Treasury in anticipation oftheEstimate. Under the circumstances may a K form be accepted signed by Mr Luehmann in the absence of the Govt Botanist'.

Total — Seventy five pounds
Shillings and
pen
